Module andrei.pt_30424_pelle_andrei_assignment_3
Package andrei.Controller

Class EditController<T>

java.lang.Object
andrei.Controller.EditController<T>
Type Parameters:
T - -> type to be edited
public class EditController<T> extends Object
This class provides the Controller for the creation/update window. The text fields are dynamically created through reflection and placed at predefined positions on the window. Whenever an error is returned by any logic/database method calls, an alert will be shown that describes the error that was encountered.

  • Method Details

    • onAccept

      public void onAccept(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws ClassNotFoundException, NoSuchMethodException, InvocationTargetException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException, IntrospectionException
      If the user accepts the edit, creation, the field information will be extracted with reflection, an object will be created with the required fields and then passed onto the database for further processing. If a string was returned, showAlert() will be called and an alert will be displayed on the screen.
      Parameters:
      e - -> parameter used to close the stage
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException
      NoSuchMethodException
      InvocationTargetException
      InstantiationException
      IllegalAccessException
      IntrospectionException

    • extractFieldInformation

      private boolean extractFieldInformation(int i, T entry, Field[] fields) throws IntrospectionException, IllegalAccessException, InvocationTargetException
      This method will extract the information from the text fields. Will return false if the data cannot be parsed properly. Further validation will be provided by the controller.
      Throws:
      IntrospectionException
      IllegalAccessException
      InvocationTargetException

    • onCancel

      public void onCancel(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Parameters:
      e - -> parameter used to close the stage

    • loadData

      public void loadData(T toEdit) throws IntrospectionException, InvocationTargetException, IllegalAccessException
      The object received as parameter will be used to populate the text fields (which are stored in the TextField array) with the information already present in the database. Thus, it will be clear to the user what properties are actually changing and which are left as-is. The label is also set when i==0, however this is not an editable field for the user.
      Parameters:
      toEdit - -> object with the required information
      Throws:
      IntrospectionException
      InvocationTargetException
      IllegalAccessException

    • setType

      public void setType(Class<T> type)
      Initially, the window has only the cancel and accept buttons. I generated the rest of the fields using reflection, set them at a certain x and y from the chosen starting location. The UI elements are held in a variable size list of label and text fields.
      Parameters:
      type - -> type parameter for controller: Order, Product or Client

    • setController

      public void setController(TableController<T> controller)

    • showAlert

      private void showAlert(String msg)
      Generates and shows an alert with the provided text given as parameter to method.
      Parameters:
      msg - -> message to be set
